meanings.definition: A person who wastes or spends extravagantly.
meanings.sent1: The squanderers in the story quickly spent all their money on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: The squanderers at the mall bought expensive items without thinking about saving.
meanings.sent3: The squanderers in the movie comically bought a hundred umbrellas on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The squanderers in the neighborhood were like water flowing through a sieve, money slipping away.
meanings.sent5: The image of the squanderers throwing cash into the air stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Those who recklessly waste resources or opportunities.
meanings.sent1: The squanderers of time never completed their tasks on time.
meanings.sent2: The squanderers of food threw away perfectly good leftovers.
meanings.sent3: The squanderers of chances missed every opportunity that came their way.
meanings.sent4: The squanderers of talent let their skills go to waste like a forgotten garden.
meanings.sent5: The squanderers of energy burned through their reserves without a second thought.
